intro: Ganua glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth ganua, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Uganda and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded areas within forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
